results.title: Basic stairbuilding
results.brief_description: Master carpenter Scott Schuttner will instruct you on how to build solid and attractive stairs by assembling two common staircases: a straight run stair and an L-shaped stair. You will also discover how a professional troubleshoots and corrects problems, how to calculate and mark the rise and run for any length stair, anchor posts and handrails and fasten treads and risers. During the action, the camera takes you where your eyes want to be.

results.title: Basic skills. Pt. 2
results.creator_credit: University of Queensland. Dept. of Human Movement Studies and Sally Methven
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Hockey film”.
The second in a series of films in which well-known international women’s hockey players demonstrate their skills. The basic skills of push pass, push in, attacking and defensive dodges, tackling, jab and Lunges are shown.

results.title: Basic skills of women's basketball
results.brief_description: This films uses slow motion and still photography to demonstrate the necessary skills required for women’s basketball. Skills dealt with include passing, catching, dodging, foot work, goal shooting and intercepting. No other credits available.

results.title: Basic skills
results.creator_credit: Gerard Holdsworth Productions and Don Kelly
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Table Tennis”
Part 1 of a series of four films which show that table tennis is a very competitive sport played throughout the world by people of all ages. This film shows certain basic qualities essential for table tennis and the fundamental techniques.

results.title: Basic shots
results.brief_description: Defines and illustrates the range of film shots from very long to very close as used in television production. Discusses basic composition rules for one person, several, groups and crowds. No other credits available.

results.title: Basic shooting techniques
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basketball Skills”.
Narrated by Ron Pickering, this is one in a series of films on basketball skills, giving instruction and demonstration of basketball techniques, including slow-motion action and training routines. No other credits available.

results.title: Basic Sewing Skills for Stretch Knits
results.brief_description: Hosted by Paula Duncan, this Woman’s Day program will provide you with all of the necessary basic information on stretch knit sewing. Armed with the basics you will then be able to make garments ranging from loose fitting T-shirts to after-five frocks.

results.title: Basic riding techniques
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Timothy Read, Peter Johnson and Tony Hansen
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Motorcycle safety”.
Peter Wherrett and Jenny Johnson discuss why a learner should begin on a 250cc bike. Looks at instruments and controls and explains their application and proper usage. Recommends the best clothing and gear to wear for comfort and safety.

results.title: Basic reproduction processes in the graphic arts
results.brief_description: Explains briefly the four basic printing processes - letterpress, gravure, lithography and silk screen. The general principles are demonstrated as well as the means of preparing images for printing including the linotype and monotype machines, and mechanical and chemical photocopying equipment. Various types of printing presses are shown and reference is made to flexography for the printing of flexible packaging. No other credits available.
